content.question: A student puts a vertical block-spring system in motion by pulling down on the block and then giving the block a quick push upward. A motion sensor placed under the moving block produces the graph of velocity <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> shown above. Which of the following gives the best estimate for the frequency of the motion of the block and the blockâ€™s maximum displacement from equilibrium?

choices.label: Frequency Maximum Amplitude <math alttext="1.6 hertz" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.6</mn><mtext> Hz</mtext></math> <math alttext="15 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mn>15</mn><mtext> cm</mtext></math>

Frequency Maximum Amplitude <math alttext="0.63 hertz" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.63</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>Hz</mtext></math> <math alttext="4 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mtext> cm</mtext></math>
Frequency Maximum Amplitude <math alttext="0.80 hertz" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.80</mn><mtext> Hz</mtext></math> <math alttext="30 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mtext> cm</mtext></math>

Frequency Maximum Amplitude <math alttext="0.63 hertz" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.63</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>Hz</mtext></math> <math alttext="15 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mn>15</mn><mtext> cm</mtext></math>
Frequency Maximum Amplitude <math alttext="1.6 hertz" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.6</mn><mtext> Hz</mtext></math> <math alttext="4 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mtext> cm</mtext></math>

content.answer: Frequency Maximum Amplitude <math alttext="0.63 hertz" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.63</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>Hz</mtext></math> <math alttext="4 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mtext> cm</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
